website_summaries.verdict: The Vasque Breeze III GTX gained mixed feedback from experts and neophytes alike. Regarding comfort and traction, this boot seems to hit the bull’s eye. However, it appears that there was something amiss with its durability and quality. In summary, the Vasque Breeze III GTX may have reached its third generation, however, its ability to last is now in question and may dampen its reputation.
pros: Several Vasque Breeze III GTX owners admired its breathability
It kept their foot cool even in hot weather
Its right-out-of-the-box comfort was lauded by a majority of hikers
A couple of experts mentioned that the Breeze III GTX gripped well in most trail conditions
It virtually had no break-in time, as observed by plenty of users
A bunch of Vasque patrons were stoked with its cozy feel
The Breeze III GTX rendered great support especially on bumpy areas, according to several day hikers and bloggers
Many online buyers commended the boot’s protection against wet elements
cons: The sole showed signs of wear too soon, based on a lot of consumer reviews
A significant number of brand loyalists stated that the quality of the Breeze III GTX was not as good as its predecessor
Some users mentioned that it runs narrow

customer_reviews.title: These do not fit like previous Vasque boots I've had
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit like previous Vasque boots I've had. I've had several pairs of the 2 (as opposed to the current 3). And these are much tighter on the outsides of my feet. I've been doing 600 miles a year in the old ones with no problems. But I can't hike more than a mile or two before these start to hurt significantly. Is anyone else having this problem? I can't believe they'd change the fit that much on the same model/line.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of these boots, I wore the first pair until they were falling apart. This pair is not the same quality, they feel cheaply made on my foot. Everyone I lift my foot there is a thawp sound like the soles are loose or made of cheap matetials. For the price I expected a quality pair of boots, but that's not what I recieved.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: returning customer and happy with Vasque quality
customer_reviews.text: Hubby wear these everyday as work boot. He tried many brands but the VASQUE are the most durable, light weight and waterproof. Lasting about 11 to 14 month with daily heavy duty outdoor wear.
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Sweet boot, with a caveat
customer_reviews.text: Feels just like the old Breeze 2, which I owned two pairs of and loved to bits. Good job on this model, Vasque! The only issue I have is with the tongue seam that runs along the top inside of the boot; one side presses on the top of my foot and might be bothersome to debilitating on backpacking trips or long day hikes. We shall see. I’ll update this review when I find out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bombac

customer_reviews.title: ... to put them to use yet but they fit great and seem like they're quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had too much time to put them to use yet but they fit great and seem like they're quality construction. The left one cuts into my ankle a little bit but that should go away once they get broken in more. If you are on the fence on size definitely go at least half a size larger. Having worn all different types and brands of boots being in the military I've learned I'm a solid 10 when it comes to most boots and if I hadn't got a 10.5 with these then they definitely would have been too small. Width feels fine for what I expected. Overall pleased with what I got and don't expect any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Comfort, Durability, and Sturdiness!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for my husband as his old hiking boots (another brand that he never liked) wore our prematurely. I've had my Vasques for over 10 years and LOVE them. They are the most comfortable shoes I own, so when he needed to replace them I encouraged him to buy Vasques. He loves them - they are sturdy and comfortable. Neither of us will ever buy another brand when these need to be replaced. A great value for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: Kept this one instead of the Merrill. Fit was better and overall I walked about 50 miles on vacation. No blisters, no break in needed. My feet thanked me. I used it for a side hunting trip and was pleased with the grip and stability. Didn't really need 8" hunting boots. Will have to rethink my prejudice toward taller hunting boots.
customer_reviews.author: Weston Cotten

customer_reviews.title: No need to break this shoe in.
customer_reviews.text: I am going hiking through Ireland in September. My husband and I will also go to Patagonia next year. We wanted a hiking shoe that will be waterproof, sturdy, comfortable and safe. I have a tendency to turn my ankle and I appreciate this high top design. We hike during the weekends in hot Alabama weather and my feet aren't terribly hot nor uncomfortable. My husband and I did a 7 mile, uphill hike the first time we wore this shoe and it didn't need any breaking in. I am very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable with great support
customer_reviews.text: I tried these on at a local store before buying them and found they were the most comfortable without any breaking in needed. Hiked on all different terrain on a two week road trip across the US. I’ve had problems with rolling ankles in regular hiking shoes and these have great support. There were times when I knew I would have rolled an ankle, only for these to give enough support to stop it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a 10 in these and they fit perfect with thick sock or regular tube sock
customer_reviews.text: These were pricier than others that I tried but we're the only ones that fit.I wear either a 9.5 or 10 depending on the sizing.I ordered a 10 in these and they fit perfect with thick sock or regular tube sock.They look exactly as the picture on Amazon's site and are very comfortable.To me the weight is not much different than a regular sneaker. I just got them so I cannot comment on wear but they seem very well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Right fit on right side
customer_reviews.text: Nice cushion in foot bed however I found shoe was very tight on my right foot. Had to check make sure both boots were right size and ended up putting my boot stretcher on the right side for 4 days before it was comfortable . Had no issues with the left side at all. Got these for work and am on my feet on concrete all day now that I can wear both they do seem to be holding up well
customer_reviews.author: Slp

customer_reviews.title: Good boots with room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Boots are good. Used these boots while hiking in Rocky Mountain National Park in wet and snowy conditions. We hiked 12.5 miles every day for 4 days each. The boots caused some pressure points on my ankles and minor bruising. The hook and loop lacing lugs at the top are poorly designed - hard to lace the top of the boot without the laces coming off...
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Ninham

customer_reviews.title: These boots are wonderful! Fit like a dream
customer_reviews.text: These boots are wonderful! Fit like a dream, can hike forever in them and not have any pressure points or discomfort. I have to hike over jagged rocks often and these boots keep the bottom of my feet safe, hold-up well and seem to be fairly waterproof. I would like to sleep in them because they are so comfortable, but my wife won't let me!
customer_reviews.author: Dog Man

customer_reviews.title: Good for about a year!
customer_reviews.text: While these shoes are very comfortable right out of the box, they are no longer waterproof. At 165$ for the pair they should have lasted longer than 11 months. I have put around 350 miles on them. They should last at least 600 miles for that price. Disappointing to say the least. You can find boots that are better for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Gregb

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I always hesitate to recommend shoes based on the fit since everyone's feet are different. With that in mind, they do fit me nicely and are very comfortable. I have narrow feet and it has become difficult to find many choices in a narrow width. I'm happy with this purchase and only time will tell how well they hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Waterproof Vibram Hiking Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These run small so buy 1/2 size larger. Given these shoes are both Gore Tex and Vibram soles, the $135/pair is a good value. My pair weighs 1.18kg, more than what is in the description. Still this is an average weight for shoes of this size. The taller ankle height helps to keep the dirt out of the shoe and give one more depth in muddy or wet conditions. Very comfortable out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort!......but not long lasting
customer_reviews.text: May 2019: Very comfortable for all day wear. Very light weight with good support. They seem to be pretty water proof but not totally. Jan 2020: After 7 months or regular wear, these boots are not holding up very well. Water proofing has gone away and leather cracking near soles. These have worn out faster than any boot I have owned.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and fit as Breeze II. The new "Old Reliables?"
customer_reviews.text: This will replace the Breeze II that I have worn out, second pair. The first thing I noticed is a change in sole thickness. These are at least half the thickness of the Breeze II. I am concerned they won't wear as well. I walk 1 mile plus every day and other pairs lasted in excess of a year.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Stocking

customer_reviews.title: Good budget option, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Yes. Is it the best? I don't believe so. Check the side of the shoes. The laces on this have to be manually wrapped around each time you tie them up. If you're with friends....it will be very annoying for all people in the group. Especially because manually looping the sides means that some of the loops accidentally get loose before you tie and then you have to redo them each time. I bought a Salomon Men's Quest 4D 3 GTX Backpacking Boots and I'm never looking back.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: By far the best hiking shoe I've ever purchased this is my second pair my first lasted me six years with many many many many miles of trail on them. I retired them to Summer work boots and now have a new pair to go backpacking with.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for weak ankles and flat feet.
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my feet all day, and have flat feet and weak ankles. These boots are a blessing. Be aware, they are painful to break in, but if you give it a day or two, they will fit like a glove, and move with your feet, and they will be happy. Great ankle and arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Korioth

customer_reviews.title: Great quality boot, lightweight.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, vibram soles and gortex uppers. Lightweight. Love them so for. Switched from Lowa’s due to lowering quality standards with increasing cost. I go 10-15 miles per trip. Hope they work.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding fit for a narrow width boot
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of boots on the market today and one need to pay attention and make sure they get one of reasonably good quality and avoid junk. The boots appear to be a cut above anything else that I've seen. Hoping that they give the kind of service that I'm expecting.
customer_reviews.author: George King

customer_reviews.title: Durable, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Had earlier version and loved them. 1,000 miles on Appalachian Trail wore out heel so got this model to replace old pair. Near 500 miles this year and they have held up to everything i threw at them. Only issue, top tie hooks are a bit small and they went with flat stings so lacing up takes care to get string down into right hook all the way.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable boots
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Philmont this year which was cancelled. I tried these and Salomon Men's Quest 4D 3 GTX Backpacking Boots and I like Vasquez better.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel K.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a day of hiking in the mountains of New England.
customer_reviews.text: My son has hiked all the mountains in New England that are 4000 feet high wearing these boots. This is a replacement pair for him. They provide support and flexibility he needs to hike for 8 hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Tashjian

customer_reviews.title: Very High Quality and Comfortable Boot
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable from day 1. On my feet 10-12 hours a day in a retail environment and using the boots for this rather than hiking. Added a Superfeet insert for more support which keeps them comfortable all day long. Improvement over Breeze II. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: John F

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots. Super Comfy.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of hiking boots that were highly recommended by a worker at REI. He was right. Super comfortable. Great grip while hiking loose and ice terrain here in Colorado.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Good everyday boots and great hikers
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the first Breeze thru to the Breeze 3 and although skeptical at first been very happy with the Breeze III. No change in fit or comfort while being more streamlined.
customer_reviews.author: Berks

customer_reviews.title: lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Just bought 2 pairs for work so I can alternate. Great fit, super light, waterproof, and breathable. I hope they last more than a year. I have bought boots costing $200+ and none of them have lasted over a year. We'll see. You gotta try lightweight hiking boots if have always wore heavy leather boots for work. They are definitely more gooder. HA
customer_reviews.author: David W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots for a trip my son took to Iceland. He said they were the most comfortable boots he’s ever had. Never had a blister and he hiked many trails and a glacier.
customer_reviews.author: The Quilted Road

customer_reviews.title: An easy boot to love!
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly what I expected, light stable hikers for an upcoming big hike in New Zealand. Great combination of a Goretex upper and a Vibram sole in a super comfortable fit. I wear a 10 1/2 to 11 definitely needed the 11
customer_reviews.author: MaineSkier

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, very comfortable, seem well made. Have put about 20 miles of trail hiking on them and so far so good. I did have to crimp the top lace hooks a bit too hold the laces better, but other than that there are great boots.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L

customer_reviews.title: Superior Quality
customer_reviews.text: I wear these full time as I own a lawn maintenance business. This is my third pair in 10 years. They are comfortable and extremely durable. You will not be disappointed. I would love to have the time to try hiking in them as I believe they would do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Anne W. Benoit

customer_reviews.title: Light weight boots
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of boots. Fit was as expected. Boots felt great right out of box. Felt like they had already been broken in. Feel very light and comfortable. So far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jankovits

customer_reviews.title: My All Time Favorite Hiking Boots
customer_reviews.text: My all time favorite hiking boots. A bit pricy, though. Also, they wear out quicker than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: jimhfoster

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for any hike
customer_reviews.text: great shoe, I managed to hike several park with it and the grip ir great, no issues if you get in the water. So far feels like a very durable shoe. The only small thing and actually its the same with my wife pair that right shoe feels a little bit smaller, not sure why but we feel the same thing. The second small thing is that if you don't tie your shoe laces all the way to the top they tent to fall off the metal hooks.
customer_reviews.author: DariusK

customer_reviews.title: They are the most comfortable boots I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my 8th or 9th pair of Vasques Breeze GTX boots. They are the most comfortable boots I've ever owned. I am a railroad freight conductor and wear these boots on large rocks.
customer_reviews.author: bobby

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for moderate hiking. They fit great, true to size, maybe slightly wide or at least not narrow like many boots run. The boots also have a great balance of breathability with a pair of medium thick wool socks you can hike all day in comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Erika & Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great fit On My Narrow 12B Foot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit. No more pain in my feet when I go hiking! Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: martha beumer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a narrow boot and the standard width here fit me well and they hold up well
customer_reviews.author: radioflyer

customer_reviews.title: Best boot
customer_reviews.text: I love my hiking boots. So comfy and sturdy. These have saved me from many ankle rolls.
customer_reviews.author: n-o-sent

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Very well-made boot and waterproof. Have walked several hundred yards (total) in ankle deep creeks and puddles. No leaks. Only have about 50-60 miles on them but still like new and just a great all-around hiking boot so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Kunze

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking footwear investment!
customer_reviews.text: These boots were a real feet savers during as a travelled during the mountains in Haiti in a humanitarian trip. Breathable, comfortable with incredible heel and arch support. I walked for 3 hours and had no blisters on the first day - my first time wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim T.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Boots great, fully waterproof up until about 2nd eyelit. No problems at all standing in 4" water for minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Queens, NY Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fit is NOT narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Sold as a narrow shoe but the toe box is huge making the shoe uncomfortable to wear for hiking or walking.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good boot. I will depend upon it for years
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good boot. I will depend upon it for years. Fits well, looks great, nice boot. Pretty light as well for a medium duty boot.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Parker Balliger

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Vasque boots for many years and have continued to purchased them as they evolve. The breeze II and now the III is yet another advancement in footwear. They feel great out of the box and perform hike after hike. I will continue to buy Vasque for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: horrible shoes
customer_reviews.text: would never by these shoes again. sizing is way off. i am between 11.5 and 12. bought size 12. if you buy these shoes get a size larger at least. tried them on at home for two days and it wasn't that bad but once I took them to work my toes started hurting. now I'm stuck with $180 shoes I don't use anymore
customer_reviews.author: janka majkutova

customer_reviews.title: Appears well made
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for walking and hiking in uneven terrain. The boot is comfortable however I think it's a little short for a true size 13.
customer_reviews.author: James Rector

customer_reviews.title: good deal ! great price !
customer_reviews.text: good deal ! can wear thick sox with no problem. true to size
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but the left was just a little too short to be comfortable and I had to send them back
customer_reviews.text: I took a risk and listened to the reviews that said these run big and I ordered a size 14D. I usually wear a 15. The right boot had enough room in the toe, but the left was just a little too short to be comfortable and I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: MBB

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very good boots! I got these for work but also use them for turkey hunting because I like them so much. They are very sturdy but surprisingly light. I am extremely hard on boots but these are well made and worth the money. I will buy again for certain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect boots
customer_reviews.text: These are truly the best boots I’ve ever owned! This is my third pair. They’re perfect for working, my knees feel better when I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: Went To Philmont Scout ranch in New mexico; Trek 75 miles for 7 days to elevation of 10,500 FT. No issues unlike my father $300.00 Salomon Boots that where broken in and had Blisters all over his Heels and Toes. Highly recommend this Boot.
customer_reviews.author: Peter J Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Different color boots.
customer_reviews.text: Came with two different color shoes. One is dark brown, the other is dark green.
customer_reviews.author: ARCTAS

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Boots Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I put 500+ miles on my previous pair, and these are already better!
customer_reviews.author: Lowryders

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe. Great support yet lightweight. Very breathable. Put some good hiking socks with these and get out there! My feet are narrow, so bear that in mind on the fit. They also keep the water out. Durability is unknown at this point.
customer_reviews.author: mrmetro

customer_reviews.title: Cheap imitation of a breeze ll
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the vasque breeze 2 boots for several pairs, they were not available so I opted to try this boot, it is a cheap imitation of the breeze 2 uncomfortable and unusable for me
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Know you size for hiking boots even it means trying them at a store first.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing! Vague boots are vague boots worth penny for a season!
customer_reviews.author: Eloi Santana

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, wear to work and keeps feet warm and dry. Excellent boot.
customer_reviews.author: Sonfish

customer_reviews.title: Still a great brand.
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, very comfortable. Hardly any breaking in needed.
customer_reviews.author: PublicName

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking rocky mountains.
customer_reviews.text: The side lace holders could be better. The laces slip out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: John Glassmire

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and relatively light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and relatively light weight. I have taken several short hikes in these boots and have not experienced any "break-in" discomfort or issues.
customer_reviews.author: R...

customer_reviews.title: Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: Box came without any kind of exterior, just box with boots picture. It was a gift, now my husband knows what he is getting and someone could have just taken them. Not very happy.
customer_reviews.author: shelby keck

customer_reviews.title: Fit well out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and good fit but sole wears out quickly on pavement.
customer_reviews.author: teddythemechanic

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: Having a narrow foot has always been problematic. These boots fit nicely, at the correct length with room for my toes without pinching the back of the heel.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Miller

customer_reviews.title: Top flight hiking boot...
customer_reviews.text: A hair large......I needed between 2 sizes, and the smaller size was too tight.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: That this product was used and dirty with mud.
customer_reviews.text: The boots have mud on them. They were worn and are not new! The tags were put back on and sold to me as new. This is unacceptable and should get a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: Billie E. Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Comfy with great stability
customer_reviews.text: Laced it a bit loose on easy trails....tighter for serious climbs. Feels like a running shoe with ankle support. Get a pair and see!
customer_reviews.author: Dave K

customer_reviews.title: I would walk 500 miles
customer_reviews.text: I've bought so many pairs of these boots. I get about 500 miles out of a pair and hope they never stop making them.
customer_reviews.author: mishigas

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of water proof boots.
customer_reviews.text: Taken many hikes in the woods, love being able to walk in large puddles with my dog, and not being worried. My feet have stayed nice and dry. It has been easy to clean mud off as I just take a hose to them while I wear them.
customer_reviews.author: DC mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice work boot.
customer_reviews.text: Been a Vasque wearer for decades. They discontinued the Clarion so I switched to the Breeze. Overall pretty happy. They do seem to run small to their marked size. Overall I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: chafemasterj

customer_reviews.title: Perfect set of hiking boots.
customer_reviews.text: Comfort on the very first day. No need to break in. Water beads right off. Go to REÍ to find your size but get a better deal on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: No break in required!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! Put them on and climbed Mount St. Helens in them - no break in required! Enough said!
customer_reviews.author: Kirill Perian

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they once were...
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as some Vasques I had years ago. The quality seems to have gone downhill a bit. But still a good hiking boot.
customer_reviews.author: N. L.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: As usual Vasque is excellent right out of the box.... it’s my 4th pair of boots and I always love them
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Good boots, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. Good boots, good fit, and a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl A. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Top Brand with Narrow sizes
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find narrow size shoes, this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Warm, breathable, water proof, very comfortable. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Diana B.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Light, great quality, very comfortable since first time. I ordered them 1 size bigger, fit great
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Lopez

customer_reviews.title: not all sizes the same
customer_reviews.text: love the style second pair same size on both sets last pair little bigger than the first
customer_reviews.author: Michael Accettura

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BOOT. IT FIT EXACTLY AS IT WAS SUPPOSE ...
customer_reviews.text: I TRIED AT AN RETAIL STORE AND DECIDED TO PURCHASE FROM AMAZON. AWESOME BOOT. IT FIT EXACTLY AS IT WAS SUPPOSE TO. TOOK THEM OUT FOR A TEST HIKE AND THEY PERFORMED UP TO SPECS. HAPPY WITH THE PURCHASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: calavera

customer_reviews.title: Best Boots Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best boots I ever owned. Very comfortable. They keep my feet warm and dry in our wet and snowy weather.
customer_reviews.author: PlOuMM

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking boots! Very comfortable right out of the box. This is my second pair of Vasque boots. The first pair lasted nearly ten years.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Waide

customer_reviews.title: Sized smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, just sized about 1/2 size smaller than expected. Size 9 fits more like size 8.5.
customer_reviews.author: gvancitters

customer_reviews.title: Vasque boots
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. I'm upset to hear that they discontinued this style.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hansen

customer_reviews.title: No break in period
customer_reviews.text: I've always had trouble finding comfortable hiking boots. These are perfect! No break in period. Just put them on and go.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Lavoie

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Boots are excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots! This is my third pair and recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boman

customer_reviews.title: What I wanted
customer_reviews.text: So far these are great. Began my training in them for a big upcoming hiking trip. Very comfortable and not too heavy
customer_reviews.author: jbcarter07

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these, stayed dry on an all day hike in the slushy snow and rain. 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Bond

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, especially with the fact I have narrow feet and most boots do not fit well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Nice high ankle for better support
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, Lightweight and durable. High ankle support and good comfort. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: hese Vasque boots are the “slimist” best fitting of all the hiking boots I have found
customer_reviews.text: Finding shoes to fill a long narrow 12A foot is problematic to say the least. With that in mind, hese Vasque boots are the “slimist” best fitting of all the hiking boots I have found. I just wish they were a little lighter and a little more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Another Old Guy

customer_reviews.title: Vasque boots are and for a return customer to them
customer_reviews.text: Fit and comfort of the shoe are very good and short break in period.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Primary use is for SE Asia travel ...
customer_reviews.text: Wore 2 pair of heavy wool socks during a 5 day break in period. Great fit. Primary use is for SE Asia travel during the wet season. Upgrade from the Breeze GTX XCR and the Apex before that; both are still serviceable with the help of a little Shoe Goo. Foot stays secure when descending, no toe crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it.  This is my second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I am a repeat buyer of this product because the first pair lasted about eight years of Boundary Waters Canoe Area trips and Landscaping work.
customer_reviews.author: Kamokasie

product_meta.title: Vasque Men's Breeze 2.0 Gore-Tex Waterproof Hiking Boot
product_meta.description: Vasque's women's specific Breeze GTX hiking boot gives an athletic fit for fast, dextrous travel, while Nubuck leather and Gore-Tex protect your feet from the trail.
